post.text:
At the India Today South Conclave 2025, Andhra Pradesh Minister 
@naralokesh
 defended the National Education Policy’s three-language formula while addressing concerns raised by Tamil Nadu, which has opposed the policy, saying it amounts to the imposition of Hindi.

Lokesh said the NEP only prescribes learning three languages and does not specify Hindi as the compulsory third. 

“When I met Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan in Delhi, he made it clear that we should focus on the medium of instruction in the mother tongue. As an Indian, I know the importance of mother tongue. I also know the importance of learning Hindi,” he said.
